intro: Sorocea arnoldoi, commonly known as the Arnold's sorocea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its flowering period occurs during the late spring to early summer months. Due to habitat loss, Sorocea arnoldoi is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
